TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
22 hours ago, Beale said:

Colours complete.




and in which DDS folder of the texture of these finite elements?

1 hour ago, prinjrius said:

and in which DDS folder of the texture of these finite elements?   

The folder misc_endcaps in GameData/Tantares/Parts has the assets for those things under texture_end_general_1.dds, if you want to change them.

On 2/20/2021 at 12:47 PM, Starhelperdude said:

which have won?

black, yellow and white?

White and black won the vote.
Yellow was already a thing with a few Mir parts, and now is expanded to cover all the Progress parts (but not Almaz)

There are now some white and yellow docking ports also.

On 2/20/2021 at 9:12 AM, Nikola said:

Might make some Waterfall configs for some of these engines

We have some news incoming for this soon (TantaresLV)
But PR are always welcome if you are able to make any for Tantares proper (RCS and orbital engines, etc).

I plan to do so, but it will take some time.

On 2/19/2021 at 12:39 PM, biohazard15 said:

Some 2 cents: Rotanev structural end cap for 7K-L1 (as specified in @Friznit's wiki) becomes available much, much later than other Zond-related parts. IMO, all these caps should be available at Engineering 101, if not at the very start. They are, after all, just end caps.

Also: please consider adding RCS to Blok-D. Sure, you can add existing parts - but this looks like (and in fact is) a "kolkhoz tuning", as we like to say in Russia (means "hillbilly mod"):

  Reveal hidden contents

 

 

 

Blok-D rcs will be a thing with at some point, I j ust lost my patience modelling the inital core body of it.
Unfortunately I missed the message to sneak these in for this release (tech tree for caps), but next for sure.

 

 

Tantares Version 24.0

  •     - New craft files for revamped crafts
  •     - Updates to support new inventory system
  •     - Various fixes to part categories
  •     - Folder restructure to match TantaresSP
  •     - New textures for salyut 6 and 7
  •     - Revamp of almaz / early salyut parts
  •     - Almaz-T radar
  •     - Revamp of progress parts
  •     - Progress M2 parts
  •     - NEP Cupola part
  •     - NEP IVAs
  •     - Almaz / early salyut IVAs
  •     - New IVA props
  •     - Fixes to breaking force / torque
  •     - New recolours for almaz / early salyut and progress parts
  •     - Revamp of mir rcs thrusters
  •     - Support for neptune camera for several new and existing parts
  •     - Removed KIS support (replaced by stock system)
  •     - New textures for rassvet / mir docking module
  •     - New recolours for docking ports

Many thanks for the assistance in development.
As usual, any issues let me know. This is a large update, and though I've tested an okay amount, things can still slip through.

You can get Tantares on both GitHub, Spacedock, and CKAN.
Craft files are included in Tantares and TantaresSP.

Tantares - SpaceDock
Tantares - GitHub
(Earth Orbit Spacecraft)

Have fun!
So it is out! Thanks @Beale again!

32 minutes ago, DeadJohn said:

Thank you and all other contributors.

Do you foresee glitches if I update an existing Tantares and KSP 1.10.1 save?

Can't say for certain, but I think it should be okay.
The new inventory module has been added to parts, which won't work in KSP 1.10, but I don't think it will be breaking.

31 minutes ago, biohazard15 said:

Hopefully this does not mean the end of RealPlumes support.

Completely up to Zorg. IMO Waterfall is better looking, more flexible, and more performant than realplume, so he has my total support and understanding if he wants to drop it.

Tantares RealPlume support is provided within RealPlume stock rather than within Tantares' own files. As I mentioned in that thread, I dont really have the time to actively do new configs for RP stock as I am working on Waterfall based stuff these days (including for Tantares LV coming soon as Beale mentioned). However if anyone were to submit updates I would gladly merge them along with bug fixes. RealPlume-stock has always been a community effort and peoples contributions are always appreciated.
